sentence.Network_en: French cuisine is criticized by international food philosophers as fussy, heavy, and unadventurous.

auth_sentence.content: Without it, much here feels at best fairly unadventurous and at worst, insipid and bland.

auth_sentence.content: But, as Jack remembers, "She came in late, dressed as a cat", which he considered to be too unadventurous.

auth_sentence.content: Guffawing critics ridicule this well-oiled "Singabore", casting its good citizens as naive, skin-deep and unadventurous.
